clinical_study.brief_title: Advance Care Planning GuideTailored for Primary Care Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Novel EHR Patient Portal Advance Care Planning Delivery System

brief_summary.textblock: this project seeks to: validate results of ACP framework pilot study in a larger randomized controlled trial (rates and quality of ACP documentation) prior to using participatory design to develop an Electronic Health Record (EHR)-tethered patient portal delivered ACP communication guide, tailored for use in busy primary care settings, incorporating patients, caregivers, and primary care providers

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of Advance Care Planning (ACP) documentation as noted in description
primary_outcome.description: Presence of Electronic Health Record problem list based ACP documentation or presence of Electronic Health Record scanned completed Advance Directive document

arm_group.description: The investigators seek to conduct a pragmatic trial including 2 sister clinical sites to test an innovation using a patient portal framework for Advance Care Planning. The intervention site implemented the intervention (secure patient portal delivered pre-visit planning framework for Advance Care Planning communication). The presence of ACP and the quality of documentation will be assessed through post-intervention chart review. Practice level enrollment was sought for the trial, and the framework will be delivered to all patients during a period of roll out. About 250 patients will receive the intervention.
The control site delivered usual care during the same period of roll out.

intervention.intervention_name: Patient Centered Medical Home Based Electronic Framework for Advance Care Planning
intervention.description: The intervention tested a pre-visit ACP workflow centered around a framework sent via secure Electronic Health Record (EHR)-linked patient portal in a real world clinical setting. The primary objectives were to determine its impact on frequency and quality of ACP documentation.
intervention.other_name: Secure patient portal delivered pre-visit planning for advance care planning

study_pop.textblock: The investigators seek to test participant intervention in a pragmatic primary care environment to the patient populations described above.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- must have an activated patient portal account over 50 years of age scheduled for a well visit appointment or chronic visit follow up English speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- under 50
- inactive patient portal account
